chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Derek J Kressel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Good faith effort to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or school, and if not, must complete 5 hours of community service per week.

Counseling.  Continue Individual Sex Treatment.  

No use of Facebook or Craig's List except for work.  No contact with children under 18 years of age as set forth in bond.  

No sex offender registration unless revoked.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

to Dismiss DEOJ
Review hearing on May 10, 2017 at 01:10 pm.
from Atty Lawson to ADA Gramer
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
DEOJ Agreement on Count 1
Katherine Wright, PhD (SEALED)

No contact with victim(s):  children under 18 years of age unless incidental in public or work. May be allowed contact with minor nieces if it is supervised by an adult 25 years of age or older.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No use of computer or Internet.

Case Called: 10:11am. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears by and with Atty Richard Lawson. State moves for leave of Court to file Information. Atty Lawson does not object to Amend Information. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. PLEA: GUILTY - amend ct 1 (child enticement) (948.07(1); amend ct 2 (sex intercourse w/child) (948.09).
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def deferred on amend ct 1 and guilty on amend ct 2. Statements by State & Defense. 
 COURT ORDERS: DEOJ - 2 yrs on Amend Ct 1 (child enticement). Crt adopts & approves Deferrend Entry Agreement. 
COURT FURTHER ORDERS: Amend Ct 2 (sex intercourse w/child)- SWH 1 yr probation. CONDITIONS: Counseling; Continue Individual Sex Treatment; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school and if not must complete 5 hrs community service per week; No use of Facebook or Craig's List except for work; No contact with children under 18 yrs of age as set forth in bond; Court Costs; DNA Surcharge.State indicates no Sex Offender Registration unless revoked. Credit of 2 days if revoked. COURT ORDERS psychological report SEALED. Atty Lawson moves for bond to be amended to signature bond. State in agreement. COURT ORDERS: Bond amended to $5,000 signature with same conditions. COURT ORDERS money returned to surety after fees are taken out. DATES: Review 5/10/17 @ 1:10pm.BR 1. Adjourned: 10:32am.
Plea hearing on May 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 14, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on March 24, 2015 at 11:20 am.
Status conference on March 9, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference on February 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Probable Cause Found

Case called: 1:19pm.  Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears by Atty Richard Lawson. Matter set for Contested Prelim and 2 Mtns to Dismiss. Crt addresses Mtns to Dismiss. Arguments by State & Defense. Crt makes findings. Crt denies Mtns to Dismiss. Detective WSPD Jon Kindlarski sworn & testifies - stipualation to identification. Crt finds probable cause & binds defendant over for arraignment and trial. State moves for 30 days to file Information -crt grants. Bond to Continue. DATES: Set further dates. Adjourned: 1:41pm.
Preliminary Hearing on January 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
